cont.entity_a: The system makes cold brew coffee concentrate effectively. The coffee flavor is excellent, especially for New Orleans-style cafe au lait. The coffee concentrate is strong and lasts a week.
cont.entity_b: The percolator brews coffee quickly and keeps it hot. The percolator makes great coffee but has design flaws. The percolator brews hot coffee with a strong flavor. The percolator brews coffee with a full-bodied flavor.

cont.entity_a: The glass pitcher is thin and fragile. The product is fragile, with reports of cracks and leaks.
cont.entity_b: The percolator is made of low-quality materials. The basket and spreader are made of cheap material. The product is made of thin metal and lacks a water level indicator.

cont.entity_a: The product lacks a lid, leading to potential exposure to external odors. The Toddy system can be messy.
cont.entity_b: The product lacks an on-off button. The cord is short, making pouring difficult. The percolator is noisy when in use. The product trips GFCI outlets, indicating a grounding issue. The percolator lacks features like an automatic shut-off. The percolator is attractive and takes up less space than drip coffee makers. The percolator is prone to tripping circuit breakers.

EaseOfUse.comm: The product is easy to use and clean.

cont.entity_a: The filter simplifies cleanup. Filter bags are recommended for ease of use.
The product is expensive given its plastic components.
cont.entity_b: The product has a short lifespan and poor durability.

cont.entity_a: Coffee leaks during steeping despite the stopper. The system reduces acidity in coffee. The system is effective for making non-acidic coffee.
cont.entity_b: Brewed coffee contains grounds. The percolator requires coarsely ground coffee for best results. The product sometimes fails to brew properly.

cont.entity_a: The included recipes can be adjusted to taste.
